intro: Hieracium suecicum, commonly known as Swedish hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to northern Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist meadows, woodlands, and along stream banks, preferring well-drained soils. Its yellow-orange flowers bloom from June to August, and the leaves are lance-shaped with a rough texture. Hieracium suecicum is often found in open habitats and can form dense colonies, making it a notable component of its native ecosystems.
